The causal chain of dependent originatio: When ignorance exists, choices come to be.
When choices exist, consciousness comes to be.
When consciousness exists, name and form come to be.
When name and form exist, the six sense fields come to be.
When the six sense fields exist, contact comes to be.
When contact exists, feeling comes to be.
When feeling exists, craving comes to be.
When craving exists, grasping comes to be.
When grasping exists, continued existence comes to be.
When continued existence exists, rebirth comes to be.
When rebirth exists, old age and death come to be.
The causal chain of cessation (a causal: When ignorance doesn’t exist, choices don’t come to be.
When choices don't exist, consciousness doesn’t come to be.
When consciousness doesn’t exist, name and form don’t come to be.
When name and form don’t exist, the six sense fields don’t come to be.
When the six sense fields don’t exist, contact doesn’t come to be.
When contact doesn’t exist, feeling doesn’t come to be.
When feeling doesn’t exist, craving doesn’t come to be.
When craving doesn’t exist, grasping doesn’t come to be.
When grasping doesn’t exist, continued existence doesn’t come to be.
When continued existence doesn’t exist, rebirth doesn’t come to be.
When rebirth doesn’t exist, old age and death don’t come to be.
The titles of a noble disciple who under: One who has come to the true teaching
One who sees this true teaching
One endowed with a trainee’s knowledge
One who has entered the stream of the teaching
A noble one with penetrative wisdom
One who stands knocking at the door of the deathless.
